question_text: What is the effect of excluding too many addresses from a DHCP scope?
answer_options: The DNS server will reject the scope
DHCP will assign incorrect subnet masks
There may not be enough available IPs for clients to lease
The DHCP process will skip the Acknowledge phase
correct_answer: There may not be enough available IPs for clients to lease
explanation: If exclusions significantly reduce the available IP pool, some clients may fail to obtain addresses.
